title: Bank of New York Mellon Chief Executive Todd Gibbons to Step Down
sub_head: Vice Chair Robin Vince, a Goldman Sachs veteran, tapped to succeed him
body:
Bank of New York Mellon Corp. Chief Executive Todd Gibbons plans to retire, following a nearly three-year tenure in which he steered the custody bank through the upheaval of the coronavirus pandemic.
The company is set to announce Thursday that it is naming Vice Chair Robin Vince, a former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. partner, to be its new CEO. Mr. Gibbons will step down on Aug. 31, with Mr. Vince serving as president and CEO-elect until then. Mr. Vince is also expected to replace Mr. Gibbons on the bank’s board.
